summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with a Bureau of Prisons Correctional Counselor (formerly a Lieutenant) regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The interview focuses on the interviewee's role, procedures for counts and rounds in the SHU, knowledge of Epstein's required cellmate status, and the events surrounding Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate who died by suicide in the SHU at MCC on August 10, 2019. The interview extensively discusses the circumstances leading to his death.

persons.name: Bullock
persons.context: Supervisor who escorted Epstein from attorney conference to SHU on August 9, 2019, and stated he would give Epstein a legal call.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The interviewee's former supervisor. Mentioned in context of emails and instructions regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Lieutenant Rice
persons.context: The SHU lieutenant at the time, believed to have known Epstein required a cellmate.

persons.name: Lieutenant Stanley
persons.context: Called the interviewee on the morning of August 10, 2019, to inform him of Epstein's suicide attempt and direct him to the hospital.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: Newer officer who was mandated to work in SHU overnight on August 9-10, 2019. Name appears on count slips.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: Officer known to the interviewee for a few years, but no personal relationship.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: SHU officer who wrote a memo stating he passed on information that inmate was leaving WAB and Epstein would need a new cellmate.

persons.name: Inmate
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was transferred out of MCC WAB (With All Belongings) on the morning of August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

persons.name: Inmate
persons.context: Inmate involved in a contraband incident in the visiting room on August 9, 2019, leading to a dry cell placement.

persons.name: Inmate
persons.role: Inmate (Epstein's cellmate during first suicide attempt)
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate during his first alleged suicide attempt on July 23, 2019; reportedly notified staff.

persons.name: Giovanne Bousy
persons.context: Another inmate listed as 'transfer within' on the prisoner production list for August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: Psychologist who sent an email stating Epstein was required to have a cellmate.

persons.name: Mobile
persons.context: Head of Facilities, mentioned in relation to camera systems.

persons.name: Com Tech
persons.context: Responsible for camera systems at MCC.

persons.name: El Chapo
persons.context: High-profile inmate previously housed in 10 South at MCC without incident.

connections.description: was Epstein's cellmate until he was transferred out WAB on the morning of August 9, 2019.
was Epstein's cellmate during his first alleged suicide attempt in July 2019.
passed on information about 's departure and Epstein's need for a cellmate to and other oncoming staff.
Bullock escorted Epstein from attorney conference to SHU on the evening of August 9, 2019, and stated he would give him a legal call.
As SHU Lieutenant, Rice was responsible for knowing and enforcing that Epstein required a cellmate.

events.title: Transfer of Inmate
events.description: Inmate , Epstein's cellmate, is transferred out of MCC WAB (With All Belongings) at 8:38 a.m., leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

events.title: SHU Officer Memo
events.description: SOS writes a memo stating he passed on information at 1:50 p.m. that was WAB and Epstein would need a cellmate upon return from attorney visit.

events.title: Epstein's Last Escort
events.description: Bullock escorts Epstein from attorney conference to SHU in the evening, telling the interviewee he would give Epstein a legal call.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found unresponsive in his SHU cell and is later pronounced dead at the hospital.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's first alleged suicide attempt while in custody at MCC.

events.title: Previous MCC Suicide
events.description: An inmate named Edwards committed suicide in the SHU in 2003 despite having a cellmate.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
10 South unit at MCC (Super Max unit)
L tier in SHU (where Epstein's cell was located)
Hospital where Epstein was pronounced dead
keyFacts: The interviewee, a BOP Correctional Counselor (formerly a Lieutenant), was on duty the night Epstein was brought to MCC and processed him in, unaware of his high-profile status.
Epstein was required to have a cellmate per Psychology's 'hot list' due to his prior suicide attempt, a fact communicated via email to lieutenants.
Epstein's cellmate, , was transferred out of MCC WAB on the morning of August 9, 2019, but Epstein was not given a new cellmate, violating the requirement.
The interviewee states that if he had known Epstein was without a cellmate, he would have ensured he got one, but he was not informed by day shift staff.
The interviewee believes Epstein committed suicide and acted alone, but notes systemic issues like staff exhaustion and lack of consistent SHU crews contributed to the failure to prevent his death.
